results.definition: condition of heightened watchfulness or preparation for action
examples: bombers were put on alert during the crisis

results.definition: warn or arouse to a sense of danger or call to a state of preparedness
examples: We alerted the new neighbors to the high rate of burglaries

results.definition: engaged in or accustomed to close observation
examples: caught by a couple of alert cops
alert enough to spot the opportunity when it came
constantly alert and vigilant, like a sentinel on duty

results.definition: a warning serves to make you more alert to danger
an automatic signal (usually a sound) warning of danger
